Description.Content: Provides support for property animations; an animation defined in XML that modifies properties of the target object, such as background color or alpha value, over a set amount of time.

A container that holds other animation elements ('objectAnimator', 'valueAnimator', or other 'set' elements). Represents an AnimatorSet. You can specify nested 'set' tags to further group animations together. Each 'set' can define its own ordering attribute.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
Specifies the play ordering of animations in this set.
Play animations in this set sequentially.
Play animations in this set at the same time.
Base class for value animations.
Holds information about a property and the values that that property should take on during an animation
Do not specify this attribute if the value is a color. The animation framework automatically handles color values
Specifies that the animated values are integers.
Specifies that the animated values are floats.
Values are paths defined as strings. This type is used for path morphing in AnimatedVectorDrawable.
values are colors, which are integers starting with '#'.
The name of the property to animate.

The value where the animated property starts. If not specified, the animation starts at the value obtained by the property's get method. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).
The value where the animated property ends. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).
The value where the animated property ends. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).
Holds a time/value pair for an animation.
Do not specify this attribute if the value is a color. The animation framework automatically handles color values
Specifies that the animated values are integers.
Specifies that the animated values are floats.
Values are paths defined as strings. This type is used for path morphing in AnimatedVectorDrawable.
values are colors, which are integers starting with '#'.
The starting value.
Defines a per-interval interpolator for this keyframe. This interpolator will be used to interpolate between this keyframe and the previous keyframe.
The keyframe fraction
This must be the root element. Contains one or more 'item' elements.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.

The object's property to animate, referenced by its name. For example you can specify 'alpha' or 'backgroundColor' for a View object. The objectAnimator element does not expose a target attribute, however, so you cannot set the object to animate in the XML declaration. You have to inflate your animation XML resource by calling loadAnimator() and call setTarget() to set the target object that contains this property.
The value where the animated property ends. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).

The value where the animated property starts. If not specified, the animation starts at the value obtained by the property's get method. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).
The time in milliseconds of the animation. 300 milliseconds is the default.
The amount of milliseconds the animation delays after start() is called.

How many times to repeat an animation. Set to '-1' to infinitely repeat or to a positive integer. For example, a value of '1' means that the animation is repeated once after the initial run of the animation, so the animation plays a total of two times. The default value is '0', which means no repetition.

How an animation behaves when it reaches the end of the animation. android:repeatCount must be set to a positive integer or '-1' for this attribute to have an effect. Set to 'reverse' to have the animation reverse direction with each iteration or 'repeat' to have the animation loop from the beginning each time.
Reverses the direction of the animation when the end or start is reached.
Repeats the animation from the start when the end is reached.
Do not specify this attribute if the value is a color. The animation framework automatically handles color values
Specifies that the animated values are integers.
Specifies that the animated values are floats.
Values are paths defined as strings. This type is used for path morphing in AnimatedVectorDrawable.
values are colors, which are integers starting with '#'.
Performs an animation over a specified amount of time. Represents a ValueAnimator.
Defines the XML namespace, which must be 'http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android'.
The value where the animation ends. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).
The value where the animation starts. Colors are represented as six digit hexadecimal numbers (for example, #333333).
The time in milliseconds of the animation. 300 milliseconds is the default.
The amount of milliseconds the animation delays after start() is called.

How many times to repeat an animation. Set to '-1' to infinitely repeat or to a positive integer. For example, a value of '1' means that the animation is repeated once after the initial run of the animation, so the animation plays a total of two times. The default value is '0', which means no repetition.

How an animation behaves when it reaches the end of the animation. android:repeatCount must be set to a positive integer or '-1' for this attribute to have an effect. Set to 'reverse' to have the animation reverse direction with each iteration or 'repeat' to have the animation loop from the beginning each time.
Reverses the direction of the animation when the end or start is reached.
Repeats the animation from the start when the end is reached.
Do not specify this attribute if the value is a color. The animation framework automatically handles color values
Specifies that the animated values are integers.
Specifies that the animated values are floats.
